1/* Invoke dup, but avoid some glitches.
2 Copyright (C) 2001, 2004, 2005 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
3

6 the Free Software Foundation; either version 2, or (at your option)
7 any later version.
8

10 but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
11 MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the
12 GNU General Public License for more details.
13
14 You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License
15 along with this program; if not, write to the Free Software Foundation,
16 Inc., 51 Franklin Street, Fifth Floor, Boston, MA 02110-1301, USA. */
17#include <sys/cdefs.h>
18__RCSID("$NetBSD: dup-safer.c,v 1.2 2016/05/17 14:00:09 christos Exp $");
19
20
21/* Written by Paul Eggert. */
22
23#ifdef HAVE_CONFIG_H
24# include <config.h>
25#endif
26
27#include "unistd-safer.h"
28
29#include <fcntl.h>
30
31#include <unistd.h>
32#ifndef STDERR_FILENO
33# define STDERR_FILENO 2
34#endif
35
36/* Like dup, but do not return STDIN_FILENO, STDOUT_FILENO, or
37 STDERR_FILENO. */
38
39int
40dup_safer (int fd)
41{
42#ifdef F_DUPFD
43 return fcntl (fd, F_DUPFD, STDERR_FILENO + 1);
44#else
45 /* fd_safer calls us back, but eventually the recursion unwinds and
46 does the right thing. */
47 return fd_safer (dup (fd));
48#endif
49}
50
